keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s annual report of credit ratings agencies finds that dubious practices persist long after the subprime meltdown.

headline.print_headline: Still Missing the Mark on Ratings
headline.main: Ratings Agencies Still Coming Up Short, Years After Crisis

snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s annual report of credit ratings agencies finds that dubious practices persist long after the subprime meltdown.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column contends credit ratings industry is setting up conditions that could lead to another mortgage crisis, issuing higher grades to low-quality debt; says SEC report issued at very end of 2015, going mostly unnoticed, highlights large number of errors made by some of biggest players in industry that violate some very basic credit rating rules.
